subject: Sales
title: Writing That Sells
description: A 60-second lesson on Writing That Sells.

hook.text: Ogilvy wrote ads that moved millions. His secret wasn't creativity ‚Äî it was relentless clarity.

buildup.text: Persuasive writing strips out every unnecessary word. Brevity is respect for the reader's time.

discovery.text: Top sales copy follows a simple formula: problem, agitation, solution. Three steps, zero fluff.

twist.text: Flowery language kills sales writing. The fancier the prose, the less likely the reader finishes it.

climax.text: Write like you talk: short sentences, active voice, one idea per paragraph. Clarity always converts.

punchline.text: Clear writing sells. Clever writing confuses.

quiz.question: What is the best formula for persuasive sales copy?
